title: Microsoft CEO Hints Next Xbox Could Be Like A PC
description: GameSpot may receive revenue from affiliate and advertising partnerships for sharing this content and from purchases through links.                                          With the leap of Halo to...
body:
GameSpot may receive revenue from affiliate and advertising partnerships for sharing this content and from purchases through links.
  
              
          
                With the leap of Halo to PlayStation 5, some observers have facetiously declared the console wars to be over. Despite rumors that Microsoft is getting out of the console business, the company is working with AMD on future consoles and devices. Now, Microsoft CEO Satya Nadella has shared some thoughts about the next Xbox, which may indicate that it will be more like a PC."We want to do innovative work on the system side, on the console and PC. It's kind of funny that people think about the [Xbox] console and PC as two different things," said Nadella during an appearance on TBPN. "We built a console because we wanted to build a better PC, which could then perform for gaming. So I kind of want to revisit some of that conventional wisdom. But at the end of the day, console has an experience that is unparalleled ... I'm really looking forward to the next console."The consoles wars are now over. What does that mean for Microsoft's gaming business model?"We just want to make sure the games are being enjoyed by gamers everywhere; consoles, PC, mobile, cloud, or TV." - @satyanadella pic.twitter.com/AOGf3mj0Kf  â€” TBPN (@tbpn) October 28, 2025              Nadella went on to suggest that there may need to be new interactive media to compete with short-form videos, which he sees as Xbox's real competition. A recent report stated that Nadella's compensation this past year was $96.5 million, largely through stock options. That's roughly 480 times what the average Microsoft employee makes.Microsoft has been going through a lot of turmoil in the last few years, between layoffs, game cancellations, studio closures, and price hikes for both consoles and Game Pass subscriptions. A separate report lays the potential blame on Microsoft's sky-high profit goals, which some observers believe are harming the company.Earlier this month, Microsoft unveiled its latest campaign to integrate AI and voice controls into every Windows 11 machine. Xbox box gaming boss Phil Spencer also came out and said that the company uses AI for security purposes, rather than for creative decisions when making games. But it remains to be seen if that continues.
                                  
  
    Got a news tip or want to contact us directly? Email news@gamespot.com

title: The Legend Of Zelda: Breath of the Wild Soundtrack Is Getting A Stunning $195 Vinyl Release
description: GameSpot may receive revenue from affiliate and advertising partnerships for sharing this content and from purchases through...
body:
GameSpot may receive revenue from affiliate and advertising partnerships for sharing this content and from purchases through links.
  
    
              
          
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                   The Legend of Zelda: Breath of the Wild features one of the best soundtracks in the franchise, and if you're a fan of that music, then you can look forward to a limited-edition vinyl collection featuring music from the game, produced by Laced Records. This will be available in two versions with a June 2026 shipping date, through My Nintendo Store and at Laced Records. Pricing starts at $49 for the Deluxe Double Vinyl Edition and $195 for the Collector's Edition box set.                                 The Legend of Zelda: Breath of the Wild Limited Edition Deluxe X8LP Box Set                                                                $195 | Releases June 2026                                                                                                                                                                                    The Collector's Edition is more comprehensive with 130 tracks across eight vinyl discs, and each one features alternative blue and gold splatter effects. Each vinyl is also housed inside of printed inner covers, and all of these are kept inside of an illustrated slipcase cover. Laced Records says that each of the eight discs is sequenced around a theme, mirroring Link's progression across Hyrule as he explores the kingdom, frees the Divine Beasts, and faces off against Calamity Ganon.                      The Legend of Zelda: Breath of the Wild 8LP Vinyl Box SetOriginally composed by Manaka Kataoka, Yasuaki Iwata, Hajime Wakai, and Soshi Abe, the Breath of the Wild soundtrack is also available through the Nintendo Music app, although this does require a Nintendo Switch Online subscription so that you can stream it.If you prefer physical media, you can get the Breath of the Wild soundtrack on CD for $38.71 (was $51) through Amazon, alongside several other compilations based on Nintendo games.Nintendo video game soundtracksThe Legend of Zelda: Tears of the Kingdom Original Soundtrack Deluxe EditionThe Legend Of Zelda: Tears Of The Kingdom Original Soundtrack Deluxe Edition -- $131The Legend Of Zelda: Tears Of The Kingdom Original Soundtrack -- $90.20Legend Of Zelda Breath Of The Wild Original Soundtrack -- $38.71 ($51)Legend of Zelda: Link's Awakening Original Soundtrack -- $33 ($45)The Legend of Zelda Skyward Sword Regular Edition Set -- $52The Legend of Zelda: The Wind Waker Original Soundtrack -- $41.85The Legend of Zelda: Twilight Princess HD Original Soundtrack -- $58Legend Of Zelda: Majora's Mask Original Soundtrack -- $48 ($58)The Legend of Zelda: A Link Between Worlds Original Soundtrack -- $40Legend Of Zelda: The 30th Anniversary Concert -- $29Hero of Time - Music from The Legend of Zelda Original Soundtrack -- $48 ($60)Music From the Legend of Zelda Original Soundtrack (Vinyl) -- $80Super Mario Bros Music - Nintendo 30th Anniversary -- $35.21Super Mario Odyssey: Original Game Music -- $44.80Pokemon Scarlet and Violet: Original Soundtrack -- $42.14Pokemon Sun and Moon Original Soundtrack -- $28.60Pokemon Omega Ruby and Alpha Sapphire Original Soundtrack -- $48.77Pokemon X and Y Original Soundtrack -- $37Pokemon Black 2 and White 2 Original Soundtrack -- $32.26Pokemon Red and Green: Super Music Collection -- $38Pokemon Sword and Shield Original Soundtrack -- $34.86Pokemon Legends: Arceus Original Soundtrack -- $46.42Pokemon: Best of 1997 - 2023 -- $4.77 ($58)Pokemon Let's Go Eevee and Pikachu Original Soundtrack -- $43                                Adorable New Astro Bot Collectibles Are Waiting To Be Rescued By You                         Amazon Has Tons Of Horror Movie Box Sets For Low Prices In Halloween Sale                         Lego's New Spider-Man And Iron Man Busts Get Limited-Timed Discounts                                   + Show More More Gaming, Tech, and Entertainment Deals & Preorders Links (5)                 Joe Hill's Massive New Horror-Fantasy Novel Arrives Just In Time For Halloween                         Icon Blue Limited Edition DualSense PS5 Controller Is Available Now                         Lego Technic McLaren F1 Race Car Retires Soon, Save $72 At Amazon Before It's Gone                         Pokemon TCG Amazon-Exclusive Holiday Premium Collection Is Back In Stock                         Get 10 Shudder Original Horror Movies On Blu-Ray For Only $51
